account.delete.confirm:
Are you sure you want to delete your account?
This action is irreversible and will destroy all data associated with your account.
This includes all of your missions, registrations as well as permissions granted to your account.
account.delete.feedback.nickname: The entered nickname does not exactly match your current nickname
account.delete.nickname: Enter the exact nickname of your account
account.delete.nickname.description: Please enter your current, exact nickname - including correct capitalisation - to confirm the deletion of your account
account.noChanges: No changes made to account details
button.refresh.authentication.explanatio:
You can refresh your authentication to make sure your account is updated with the correct permissions, community or likewise.
After being accepted to a community, a refresh is required before your account shows you as a community member and you can create community missions.

editor.explanation.missing: Some editor controls might be disabled or missing depending on the edited mission element
mission.access.add.explanation:
Choose communities or users that should have access to your mission and can register for slots.
By default, only you and all mission editors can see this mission - you will have to explicitly grant access to any other community or user.
Granting access to a community allows all members of this community to view the mission. Granting access to a single user only allows this user to view the mission.
mission.access.community.selection: Search for community to grant access to
mission.access.community.selection.descr: Start typing to search for a community with the given name or tag, including partial matches. You can only grant a permission to either a community or an user, but not both simultaneously

mission.access.user.selection: Search for user to grant access to
mission.access.user.selection.descriptio: Start typing to search for an user with the given nickname, including partial matches. You can only grant a permission to either an user or a community, but not both simultaneously
mission.apply.slotTemplate.description:
Apply a slot template to a mission, adding all defined slot groups at the selected position.
You can filter slot templates and select the desired template to apply.
mission.bannerImage.description: The banner image is prominently displayed below the mission title and above the mission's description
mission.bannerImage.feedback.fileType: Invalid file type (only jpeg, png and gif are allowed)
mission.briefingTime.description: Date and time the leadership briefing will be held
mission.collapsedDescription.description: An optional, collapsed mission description can be used to provide even greater mission details and preparations to your players without having to scroll endlessly every time they want to check out the slotlist. This description is collapsed by default - only displaying a toggle button - and will be displayed after the mission's detailed description and before the slotlist
mission.convert.slotTemplate.description:
You can convert the current slotlist of this mission to a slot template, allowing you to reuse the configured slot groups and slots for other missions. Slot templates do not include community restrictions or slot assignments. Converting a mission to a slot template does not modify or delete the mission's slotlist in any way.
Choose a title and a visibility setting for the converted slot template.

mission.duplicate.description:
Choose a new slug to use for the duplicated mission.
You can also overwrite the mission's title, mission times as well as visibility and community settings.
All data omitted will be replaced by the original mission's values.

mission.slot.selection.edit:
Allows you to edit certain values of 1 selected slot.
Data omitted will not be modified, you can thus only edit the values you want changed and leave the rest empty/not selected. Unfortunately, the slot statuses restricted, reserve,blocked and auto-assignable can only be removed for one slot at a time.
The following slot is affected: | Allows you to edit certain values of {count} selected slots.
Data omitted will not be modified, you can thus only edit the values you want changed and leave the rest empty/not selected. Unfortunately, the slot statuses restricted, reserve, blocked and auto-assignable can only be removed for one slot at a time.
The following slots are affected:

mission.token.description:
Mission tokens can be used as an alternative, static authentication method for embedding missions into different websites or forums. By default, all public missions can be embedded without extra configuration, however missions that do not have a public visibility setting require a mission token for embedding.
On the contrary to regular user authentication, mission tokens do not expire and only grant access to this specific mission. The information returned is identical to what a regular user would receive - no mission editor or creator specific data is provided.
By clicking the Generate button, you can generate a new mission token. Please note that this invalidates any previous tokens.
Using the Delete button, you can completely remove all mission tokens and thus remove all options to embed a non-public mission.
mission.visibility.description: Defines visibility of the mission to other users, only allowing access to selected group

notification.suppress.description: By suppressing notifications, you can prevent spamming your users due to multiple, subsequent or minor updates. If this checkbox is ticked, no notification will be created for the action performed. Please note that "destructive" actions such as slot unassignments, permission removal or mission deletion cannot have their notifications suppressed
